_prev_prog_3.CH_OtherChanges: Valves, vent pipes and relief valves were added to enhance control
_prev_prog_3.Description: Industrial Solution Services, Inc. management is extremely cautious in the handling of all chemicals and is very diligent about safety for its employees and the public. Industrial Solution Services, Inc. has established strict safety practices for handling all chemicals including aqueous ammonia production, storage and unloading into trucks. The safety practices includes strict adherence to written operating procedures, timely equipment inspection, testing and maintenance, personnel training, investigation of near misses and releases, process hazard analysis, management of change and periodic review or audit of program elements. The management of change element addresses proper implementation of system updates to ensure that all changes are reviewed properly by knowledgeable persons, all engineering documents and operating procedures reflect the change, and affected personnel are trained on the change. In addition, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are utilized to enhance safe practices.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN - Industrial Solution Services, Inc.



Industrial Solution Services, Inc. has established a Risk Management Plan (RMP) according to the California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) and the Federal EPA's Risk Management Plan (40 CFR Part 68) regulations for the Aqueous Ammonia Production System to enhance its safety practices. Industrial Solution Services, Inc. management is extremely cautious in the handling of all chemicals and is very diligent about safety for its employees, clients and public.



Industrial Solution Services, Inc. policy is to conduct all operations in a safe and conscientious manner to prevent accidental release of any hazardous material, including substances regulated through the California Accidental Release Prevention Program and Federal EPA's Risk Management Plan, i.e., aqueous ammonia. Industrial Solution Services, Inc. trains its employees to properly handle and store hazardous materials, to minimize the possibility of adversely affecting its worker's health, the workplace, the public, and the environment. Industrial Solution Services, Inc.'s Accidental Release Prevention policy is implemented through the management system contained in its RMP.



Stationary Source and Regulated Substance

The Aqueous Ammonia Production System at the Stockton Facility of Industrial Solution Services, Inc. is comprised of three ammonia storage tanks, one aqua converter, a vent scrubber, control units and piping. The Aqueous Ammonia Production System produces 19.0 wt. % and 29.0 wt. % aqueous ammonia for sale to client facilities. 



Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

Industrial Solution Services, Inc. has an RMP program in place to manage the handling of ammonia. The program includes requirements for written operating procedures, personnel training, equipment maintenance, incident investigation, process hazard analysis, management of change and periodic review or audit of program element

s. The management of change element addresses proper implementation of system updates to ensure that all changes are reviewed properly by knowledgeable persons, all engineering documents and operating procedures reflect the change, and affected personnel are trained on the change. In addition, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are utilized to ensure safe practices are being performed.



Five-Year Accident History

At the Stockton Facility of Industrial Solution Service, Inc., during the last five years (March 2015 to March 2020), there have been no incidents where a release of ammonia gas has led to an injury, fatality or environmental impact.  There were no onsite property damage, offsite evacuation, shelter in place, and property damage.



Emergency Response Program

Industrial Solution Services, Inc. maintains a emergency action plan for its Stockton operation. In the event of an accidental release of a regulated substance, the emergency action plan dictates that 9-1-1 to be dialed and local Fire Department to be summoned. The action plan includes lists of contact information for local emergency responders, as well as reporting information for the regulating agencies.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Process and management system improvements have been suggested and most are implemented. All action items to improve the safety of the covered systems are being addresses will be implemented in a short time.
